content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
RISK-ON: Low volatility environment (Vol: 15.9%) with broad participation (Breadth: 8/8 sectors positive). Market biased toward cyclicals and rate-sensitive names.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Banking and Heavy Industry front-run the market; Banking & Finance led by HALKB (1W: +15.71% | 1M: +13.58%) ABOVE TREND and AKBNK (1W: +6.97% | 1M: +11.04%) ABOVE TREND. Heavy Industry led by ASELS (1W: +16.29% | 1M: +36.56%) ABOVE TREND and TOASO (1W: +11.93% | 1M: +18.74%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Technology & Telecom is the weakest with KONTR (1W: -6.88% | 1M: -34.20%) BELOW TREND; Construction & REIT and Holding & Investment are the softer performers relative to leaders, e.g., TKFEN (1W: +4.65% | 1M: +5.87%) ABOVE TREND and DOHOL (1W: +0.33% | 1M: +1.92%) ABOVE TREND.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
ASELS (1W: +16.29% | 1M: +36.56%) ABOVE TREND; HALKB (1W: +15.71% | 1M: +13.58%) ABOVE TREND; TOASO (1W: +11.93% | 1M: +18.74%) ABOVE TREND; KCHOL (1W: +10.57% | 1M: +8.69%) ABOVE TREND; TSKB (1W: +10.35% | 1M: +3.99%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
KONTR (1W: -6.88% | 1M: -34.20%) BELOW TREND; DOHOL (1W: +0.33% | 1M: +1.92%) ABOVE TREND; ALARK (1W: +0.87% | 1M: +6.19%) ABOVE TREND; VESTL (1W: +3.31% | 1M: -7.58%) RECOVERY; OYAKC (1W: +3.72% | 1M: -3.31%) RECOVERY.

6. Momentum Stocks?
ASELS (1W: +16.29% | 1M: +36.56%) ABOVE TREND, HALKB (1W: +15.71% | 1M: +13.58%) ABOVE TREND, TOASO (1W: +11.93% | 1M: +18.74%) ABOVE TREND, KCHOL (1W: +10.57% | 1M: +8.69%) ABOVE TREND, TRMET (1W: +10.04% | 1M: +14.98%) ABOVE TREND.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banking is the tactical leader; AKBNK (1W: +6.97% | 1M: +11.04%) ABOVE TREND, GARAN (1W: +6.29% | 1M: +6.22%) ABOVE TREND, ISCTR (1W: +8.44% | 1M: +4.05%) ABOVE TREND and YKBNK (1W: +8.23% | 1M: +7.86%) ABOVE TREND show confirmed strengthâ€”overweight selective bank exposure.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Heavy Industry is firing on all cylinders: ASELS (1W: +16.29% | 1M: +36.56%) ABOVE TREND, TOASO (1W: +11.93% | 1M: +18.74%) ABOVE TREND and FROTO (1W: +7.91% | 1M: +8.20%) ABOVE TREND offer cyclicality play with momentum; monitor VESTL (1W: +3.31% | 1M: -7.58%) RECOVERY for weaker industrials.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy & Chemicals are participating but mixed; TUPRS (1W: +9.23% | 1M: +1.21%) ABOVE TREND and TRMET (1W: +10.04% | 1M: +14.98%) ABOVE TREND lead, while OYAKC (1W: +3.72% | 1M: -3.31%) RECOVERY and HEKTS (1W: +4.59% | 1M: -0.31%) RECOVERY need confirmation.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Risk-on tactical stance: overweight Banking, Heavy Industry and select Retail; trim lagging Technology & Telecom exposure and keep small cash buffer for mean-reversion. Use size to lock in profits in extreme movers (ASELS, HALKB) and rotate into high-quality mid-momentum names (TRMET, MGROS).

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
ASELS (1W: +16.29% | 1M: +36.56%) ABOVE TREND for momentum continuation, HALKB (1W: +15.71% | 1M: +13.58%) ABOVE TREND for bank leadership, TOASO (1W: +11.93% | 1M: +18.74%) ABOVE TREND for auto cycle, TUPRS (1W: +9.23% | 1M: +1.21%) ABOVE TREND for energy flow, KONTR (1W: -6.88% | 1M: -34.20%) BELOW TREND as a watch for capitulation or bounce.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Banking & Finance and Heavy Industry for leadership continuation; Energy & Chemicals for commodity/cost-driven moves and rotation opportunities.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Monitor XU100 momentum: watch for continuation above recent highs and maintain support at short-term moving averages; key catalysts are domestic CPI, CBRT communication, USD/TRY moves and global risk sentiment shifts. Earnings updates, liquidity flows and any fiscal announcements will be immediate triggers for sector rotation.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Low-volatility RISK-ON market with unanimous sector breadth and clear leadership in Banking and Heavy Industry; ASELS and HALKB are the most pronounced momentum names. Strategy: overweight cyclicals and banks, trim weak tech positions, and monitor macro catalysts (CPI, CBRT, USD/TRY) for rotation risk.
